message: even just a list of the kind types would be helpful
OK, here is what I've been able to document for myself for what the live api is sending - hopefully others find it useful: https://gist.github.com/883947
@ptone thanks. A couple of those I haven't come across.
@ptone Nice!  Thank you.
@italiano40 you can always run it locally: http://defunkt.io/hurl/
That helped thanks but @leah hurl is down and that was a lot of help too for each call
btw the way hurl is back up
cool
you beat me to it :)
I'll grab a sample
there's also an "unstar" message
also, in a star message, is message/star/user always equal to message/user? I'm unclear on the difference between the two
Also @ptone has collected some useful docs on the message types: https://gist.github.com/883947
cool, that's what it's seemed to me in my testing so far

{star:user} is the one who just starred/unstarred
{star:message:user} is the owner of the message
{star:message:stars:[users]} are all the users who starred the message

i think unstar has a bug: it still includes the user who just unstarred the message in the stars array
yeah, but what about {user}?
it appears that message/user and message/star/user are equivalent
is that correct, and which should we be using?
ok
so, the answer is "yes"
I'm using star/user, but it's unclear whether I should be using user
so you say they would be different if user a could create a star in the  name of user b
yep. it appears to me that they are identical
Ahh yes, because all of the messages have a message/user which is always the user who performed the action
i just checked. it's the user who stars a message
maybe @ericflo or @leah could shed some light on this?
Hey guys, sorry what's the confusion?
in the star message
They're often equivalent
thanks
And star is an object which also has a user, who is the user who created the star
no problem :)
So the idea is to use message/user if you want to know who did some action, and message/star/user if you want to know who created the star
cool
@EisFrei Yep
